contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox kommune | name = Masfjorden | native_name = | native_name_lang = | other_name = | official_name = | idnumber = 1266 | image_skyline = Haugsværsfjorden.JPG | county = Hordaland | district = Nordhordland | capital = [[Masfjordnes]] | language = [[Nynorsk]] | demonym = Masfjording | coatofarms = Masfjorden komm.png | munwebpage = www.masfjorden.kommune.no | mayor = Håkon Matre | mayor_party = [[Conservative Party of Norway|H]] | mayor_as_of = 2003 | area_rank = 191 | area_total_km2 = 556 | area_land_km2 = 511 | area_water_percent = 0.17 | population_as_of = 2004 | population_rank = 356 | population_total = 1712 | populationpercent = 0.04 | population_density_km2= 3 | population_increase= -7.0 | latd = 60 | latm = 50 | lats = 18 | longd = 5 | longm = 26 | longs = 55 | utm_zone = 32V | utm_northing = 6750018 | utm_easting = 0307018 | geo_cat = adm2nd }} {{Historical populations |footnote = '''''Source''': [http://www.ssb.no/english/subjects/02/02/folkendrhist_en/tables/tab/1266.html Statistics Norway]. |shading = off |1951|1928 |1960|1987 |1970|1858 |1980|1915 |1990|1891 |2000|1774 |2007|1631 |2008|1646 |2009|1652 }} '''Masfjorden''' is a municipality in the county of [[Hordaland]], [[Norway]]. Masfjorden was separated from [[Lindås]] on 1 March 1879. The municipality is located around the [[fjord]] which is also called the Masfjorden which almost divides the municipality completely into a north side and a south side. A [[cable ferry]] connects these two parts. This is the only cable ferry in Norway that transports vehicles. The main population centre is located at Nordbygda on the north side. The local council however is located on the south side. ==General information== ===Name=== The [[Old Norse]] form of the name was ''Matrsfjǫrðr''. The first element is the genitive case of the old (uncompounded) name of the fjord: ''Matr''. This name is derived from ''matr'' m which means "food" - and the meaning is "the one full of food (fish)". ===Coat-of-arms=== The [[Coat of arms|coat-of-arms]] is from modern times. They were granted on 28 September 1990. The arms feature three ''heldrer'', a traditional tool made of wood for fastening a [[rope]] around a load. They are meant to symbolize unity. Three of these objects appear in yellow and they are centered on a field of red.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.fotw.us/flags/no-12-66.html|title=Masfjorden, Hordaland|last=Engene|first=Jan Oskar |date=27 June 2002|publisher=Flags of the World|accessdate=2008-09-22}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.masfjorden.kommune.no/kommunen/kommunevaapen.html|title=Masfjorden Kommunevåpen|publisher=Masfjorden Municipality|accessdate=2008-09-22}} {{no icon}}</ref> {{See also|Øyer}} ==Geography== It contains several fjords such as [[Austfjorden (Hordaland)|Austfjorden]]. ==References== {{Reflist}} {{Hordaland}} [[Category:Municipalities of Hordaland]] [[Category:Masfjorden| ]]
